How to Install nova-ajax-console-proxy on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • nova-ajax-console-proxy

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install nova-ajax-console-proxy on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing nova-ajax-console-proxy on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall nova-ajax-console-proxy in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install nova-ajax-console-proxy, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install nova-ajax-console-proxy Using apt

To install nova-ajax-console-proxy in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install nova-ajax-console-proxy using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install nova-ajax-console-proxy

The installation of nova-ajax-console-proxy might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install nova-ajax-console-proxy Using apt-get

To install nova-ajax-console-proxy using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install nova-ajax-console-proxy.

sudo apt-get -y install nova-ajax-console-proxy

Install nova-ajax-console-proxy Using Synaptic

To install nova-ajax-console-proxy using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install nova-ajax-console-proxy on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for nova-ajax-console-proxy. This will display the nova-ajax-console-proxy package in the package window, now to install nova-ajax-console-proxy, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the nova-ajax-console-proxy package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of nova-ajax-console-proxy.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install nova-ajax-console-proxy Using aptitude

To install nova-ajax-console-proxy on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of nova-ajax-console-proxy.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install nova-ajax-console-proxy using the command aptitude install nova-ajax-console-proxy.

sudo aptitude -y install nova-ajax-console-proxy

How to Upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy on debian

If you want to upgrade the nova-ajax-console-proxy package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy

Upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy using Aptitude

To upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy

Upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy using Synaptic

To upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for nova-ajax-console-proxy, now right-click nova-ajax-console-proxy, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall nova-ajax-console-proxy on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall nova-ajax-console-proxy from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just nova-ajax-console-proxy, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove nova-ajax-console-proxy

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of nova-ajax-console-proxy

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of nova-ajax-console-proxy you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge nova-ajax-console-proxy

Remove nova-ajax-console-proxy using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall nova-ajax-console-proxy using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for nova-ajax-console-proxy, right-click the nova-ajax-console-proxy package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall nova-ajax-console-proxy click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install nova-ajax-console-proxy on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade nova-ajax-console-proxy using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of nova-ajax-console-proxy then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
